body:
Any application that is installed through the `spack` package manager, am I able to restrict the applications permissions, such as file access ~ I can specify which directories can it access and which directories it can't access, create virtual directories for the application to access, microphone, speaker, bluetooth, Internet etc?

Additionally with `spack`, am I able to get applications that are either installed outside of `spack` (installed via `pacman` or something similar) or applications that there binaries are directly being launched, am I able to some how configure it to run through `spack` and to restirct permissions?
title: Am I able to restrict applications permissions?
